entries: At 13th level if you use the Help action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding a {@item warhammer|PHB} or {@item maul|PHB}, you knock the target's defence aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the ally gains a +2 bonus to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Forgemaster
entries: Starting at 15th level your knowledge with the forge and the arts of smithing allow you to upgrade your weapons and armor to be more effective.

For each level you want to upgrade the item the process takes 3 hours and costs five times the item's value in gold. The cost represents the materials required to improve the item; for each level of upgrade a weapon gains a +1 to its attack and damage rolls or a piece of armour gains +1 to its AC.
The maximum number of levels you can upgrade a item is 2; at 18th level the maximum increases to 3.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "The flesh is weak, but deeds endure."
–The Drake, to the Gorgon

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 17th level your Strength and Constitution score bonuses increase by +1 to a total of +9 each, but your Wisdom score bonus does not go higher than +4.

subclassFeature.name: The Unbound Flame
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your bonus action to ignite a melee weapon you are holding, once ignited it deals an extra {@dice 2d6} fire damage for 1 minute and is considered a magic weapon.

Creatures hit by your weapon while this feature is active must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Constitution modifier at the start of their next turn or take an additional {@dice 2d4} fire damage.
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Raven
entries: The Sons of The Raven are dark mannered and brooding, their sombre nature belying their true power. Masters of fast, harrowing attacks that are over as swiftly as they begin, leaving only death behind.

subclassFeature.name: Hit and Run
entries: When you chose this heritage at 1st level you have learnt how to use quick retreats between your attacks to avoid danger. You may disengage as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Silence
entries: At 4th level you gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill and armour no longer imposes disadvantage to {@skill Stealth} checks. If you are already proficient in {@skill Stealth}, your proficiency bonus is doubled for that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Death By A Thousand Cuts
entries: Starting at 8th level while you are wielding a melee weapon with the light property in each hand you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with those weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "When you're on your own, behind enemy lines, no artillery, no air strikes, no hope of an evac, you don't fight dirty. You do things that make dirty look good."
–The Punisher

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "You cannot see the future with tears in your eyes."
–Navajo Proverb

subclassFeature.name: Nimble Reflexes
entries: Starting at 13th level when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Untouchable
entries: Starting at 15th level you are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't {@condition incapacitated} and are aware of the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Flaws
entries: At 16th level roll a d20, on a 1 your implant fails and you lose your Mucranoid feature. At 17th roll another d20, on a 1 your Betcher's Gland implant fails and you lose that feature too. Additionally over time your skin becomes naturally paler until almost white and your eyes and hair become a deep black.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 16th level your Dexterity score bonus increases by +1 but your Strength score bonus does not go higher than +7, and the score cannot go higher than 23.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "We are the shadow that kills, the hidden death that none suspect."
–The Raven

subclassFeature.name: Nevermore
entries: When you reach 18th level you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, if you have advantage on your first attack roll using a weapon with the light property, then on a hit you can deal three times the damage rolled; this only applies to your first attack and not any subsequent attacks on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Hydra
entries: Little is known about the Sons of The Hydra, rumours persist that there is only one in existance at any time, despite tales to the contrary, undoubtedly they indulge in deception and subterfuge on a machiavellian scale.

subclassFeature.name: The Many Heads of The Hydra
entries: When you choose this heritage at 1st level you always, whenever you're asked your name by someone whom you do not trust, simply reply: "I am one of many." or some other thematic variation there upon. Your true name is kept secret or is simply forgotten.

You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} skill, {@item disguise kit|PHB|disguise kits}, and {@item forgery kit|PHB|forgery kits}. Additionally you have advantage on rolls made to disguise yourself as someone of the same race as you.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Improvisation
entries: At 4th level you become proficient with Improvised Weapons and can use your bonus action to grapple a target hit with an improvised weapon or unarmed strike.

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 8th level you may choose one bonus from the following list:
You may dash as a bonus action.
You may disengage as a bonus action.
You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill or your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make if you are already proficient.
You may use your reaction to make an attack against a creature that enters your reach.
You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with melee weapons you are proficient with.
You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons you are proficient with.
You gain +2 to Initiative rolls.
Moving through non-magical difficult terrain does not cost extra feet of movement.
You gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make in one skill you have proficiency in.
You gain a new skill from those listed in the class features.

You may change your selection when you finish a long rest. At 13th level you may choose a second bonus from the list, and at 18th level you may choose a third. You may not choose the same bonus more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be."
–Kurt Vonnegut

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "All around me darkness gathers,
Fading is the sun that shone,
We must speak of other matters,
You can be me when I'm gone."
–The Sandman

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 13th level you may choose a second bonus from the list under your Mutable Tactics feature. You may not choose the same bonus more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Sever One Head...
entries: Starting at 15th level when you take damage you can use your reaction to cast {@spell mirror image|PHB}. Whilst the spell is active you gain a +1 bonus to your damage rolls for every duplicate you have remaining.
You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 15th level your Dexterity score bonus is increased by +1 and your Charisma score bonus is increased by +2, however your Strength and Constitution score bonuses do not go higher than +6 and both scores cannot go higher than 22.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "When evil faces evil, the Devil is not mocked."
–Ancient Proverb

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I am one of many."
–Son of the Hydra

subclassFeature.name: Blood of The Primogenitor
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your action to unleash the Blood of The Primogenitor. For 1 minute you gain a +2 bonus to your Strength and Constitution scores, you can make a single additional attack on your turn as a bonus action, and your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Any hitpoints gained by the increase to your Constitution modifier are added to your temporary hitpoints rather than your hitpoint maximum.
You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 18th level you may choose a third bonus from the list under your Mutable Tactics feature. You may not choose the same bonus more than once.
